APIUsageInformation.description: Information about Domotz API current usage and usage limits

count.description: The number of calls originated from that IP address
The number of calls done using this key in the last 24 hours

id.description: The ID of the API key

count.description: The number of calls for the resource

concurrent_allowed.description: Number of allowed calls to the API in a minute.

daily_limit.description: Number of allowed calls to the API in a 24 hours span.

daily_usage.description: Number of API call performed in the last 24 hours.

AbstractDevice.description: Base abstract class for all devices

authentication_status.description:
When defined the device requires authentication info to perform extended discovery
  • *REQUIRED*: the device requires authentication, extended discovery is locked
  • *PENDING*: credentials have been submitted but not verified yet
  • *WRONG_CREDENTIALS*: device authentication failed
  • *AUTHENTICATED*: device authentication succeeded

main_id.description: In a clustered configuration, the main device id

type.description: The device type, if recognised by domotz

api_enabled.description: If `false` the agent plan doesn't allow for API access: you only can see this agent in the list

status.description:
• *OWNED*: you own this agent
  • *PROPOSED*: the owner proposed you to access the agent, you can accept or reject the offer
  • *GRANTED*: you accepted the collaboration request for this agent
  • *ASSIGNED*: your team leader has given you access to the agent

bound_mac_address.description: The MAC address of the primary interface of the device the software agent runs on

team.description: The Team and Company Area information, only available for companies

listen_on.description: The local IP and port the Domotz Agent software is listening on if online - the last known value otherwise

timestamp.description: The time the sample was reported to Domotz

uptime.description: The uptime percentage of the agent

description.description: The description of the alert profile

events.description: The list of events associated to the profile

id.description: The id of the event profile

is_enabled.description: true if the event profile is enabled, false otherwise

name.description: The symbolic name associated to the profile

tag.description: A label associated to the profile

alert_profile_id.description: The id of the alert profile
The id of the alert profile

Area.description: Represents an area of the Company

DetectedDeviceType.description: A device type, detected by the Domotz device identification feature

id.description: An unique identifier of the type, referred in the `Device` entity

label.description: A human-readable short description of the type

DeviceBaseType.description: A device type, either set by the user or as identified by the Domotz system

id.description: An unique identifier of the type, referred in the `Device` entity

label.description: A human-readable short description of the type

vital.description: Whether a device of this type will be marked as `VITAL` as soon as recognised

timestamp.description: The time the sample was reported to Domotz
The time the sample was reported to Domotz

cycle.description: Indicates that a power cycle on the device is possible. Available if the device is connected to just one PDU.

off.description:
Indicates that the device can be powered off. Available if the device is connected to one or more PDU.

In the latter case the operation will be performed on all available PDUs.

If there no PDU but there is one POE connection, the operation will still be available through that connection.

on.description:
Indicates that the device can be powered on. Available if the device is connected to one or more PDU.

In the latter case the operation will be performed on all available PDUs.

If there is no PDU but there is one POE connection, the operation will still available through that connection.

software_reboot.description:
Indicates that software reboot on the device is possible.

The operation availability depends on the device.

timestamp.description: The time the sample was reported to Domotz

latest_lost_packet_count.description: The number of lost packets of the latest collection sample

latest_median.description: The median value of the latest collection sample

latest_sent_packet_count.description: The number of sent packets of the latest collection sample

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the latest update

agent_uptime.description: The uptime percentage of the agent

uptime.description: The uptime percentage of the device

DomotzEyesUsageInformation.description: Information about Domotz Eyes current usage and limits

limit.description: Number of allowed Domotz Eyes for the agent

snmp.description: Number of configured Domotz Eyes of type `snmp` on the agent.

tcp.description: Number of configured Domotz Eyes of type `tcp` on the agent.

total.description: Number of configured Domotz Eyes on the agent.

allOf.description:
A device that has no network access whatsoever and cannot be discovered or interacted with by
     the agent.
 
 A user can create a Dummy Device to attach it to a power outlet so that it is easier to remember which port controls
the device

A device added by the means of 'Advanced Monitoring': it is an IP device manually added by 
the user, no discoveries are done over it, just periodical ping to see whether it is reachable
Base abstract class for all IP devices

agent_reachable.description:
When `true` the device is reachable by the agent over an IP network.
When `false` Domotz knows about the status of the device by the means of another source e.g. a third party controller.

This field is significant only when the status of the device is `ONLINE` and its value is `false` because it means
that even if the IP device is up and running, many features aren't allowed, such as the direct connection or the TCP
services monitoring.

grace_period.description: The number of seconds a device must be unreachable before being declared DOWN

allOf.description: Standard device, automatically discovered in the local IP network of the agent.

is_jammed.description: When true, the Domotz Agent is blocking the device to access the Internet. The device can still reach every other device in the local network

NetworkSpeedSample.description:
A Network Speed Sample is the result of the measurement of the Internet download and upload
     speed, in bits per second, taken by the Agent

timestamp.description: The time the sample was reported to Domotz

values.description: A pair of values: the download and upload speed, in Bit Per Seconds (bps), as measured by the Agent

SNMPDomotzAuthentication.description: The SNMP authentication setting of a device

SNMPDomotzEye.description: Information about a configured SNMP Domotz Eye

device_id.description: The unique identifier of the device

id.description: The unique identifier of the SNMP Domotz Eye

last_update.description: The timestamp of the latest update

latest_value.description: The value retrieved on the OID

name.description: The name of the Domotz Eyes
The name of the Domotz Eyes

email.description: True if the email alert is active

mobile.description: True if the mobile alert is active

function_id.description: The unique identifier of the function assigned to the trigger

id.description: The unique identifier of the SNMP Trigger

cardinality.description: The number of arguments of the function

id.description: The unique identifier of the SNMP Trigger function

allOf.description:
A device automatically discovered by the agent that exists in an IP subnet defined by the user.
 The agent reaches the device through a Level 3 switch or similar device, so it cannot get the MAC address or other 
level 2 information, such as DHCP lease data

TCPDomotzEye.description: Information about a configured TCP Domotz Eye

device_id.description: The unique identifier of the device

id.description: The unique identifier of the TCP Domotz Eye

last_update.description: The timestamp of the latest update

status.description: The status of the TCP service

Team.description: Represents a team of the Company

info.description:
### The Domotz Public API

Use the "API Key Endpoint" which you can retrieve from the Domotz Portal as the Base URL for your API calls.

The Domotz Public API uses standard HTTP response codes, authentication, and verbs. JSON format is used in responses and accepted for request bodies. All date-time formats are expressed as yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss. Date-time must be expressed in UTC. Specification of different TimeZones are not allowed.

### Domotz Webhook
It is possible to subscribe to events happening on the Domotz platform, both at an Agent level and Device level, through the usage of Webhooks.

Please refer to the [user-guide](https://help.domotz.com/user-guide/shared-alerts-webhooks-ticketing-systems/) on the usage of the Webhook as a possible contact channel to receive notification of events and how to create a Shared Alert Profile. Moreover, refer to [getAlertProfiles](#getalertprofiles), [bindAlertProfileToAgent](#bindalertprofiletoagent) and [bindAlertProfileToDevice](#bindalertprofiletodevice) on how to retrieve the list of Shared Alert Profiles and bind to Agents and Devices respectively. In those same sections you also have the list of all the possible Webhook events and references to the Schemas.
info.title: Domotz Public API

get.summary: Returns the Round Trip Delay statistics for all devices monitored by the agent. The aggregate values of _avg_min_, _avg_max_, _avg_median_ help to understand the baseline response time of a device in a weekly time frame, while _latest_median_ helps detecting a possible deviation from the baseline

get.summary: Retrieves the SNMP authentication info

put.summary:
Sets the SNMP authentication info.
  • _snmp_read_community_ and _snmp_write_community_ are relevant only for _V1_ and _V2_.
  • _V3_NO_AUTH_ requires a valid _username_.
  • _V3_AUTH_NO_PRIV_ requires _username_, _authentication_protocol_ and _authentication_key_.
  • _V3_AUTH_PRIV_ requires _username_, _authentication_protocol_, _authentication_key_, _encryption_protocol_ and _encryption_key_.
